job title: Senior Associate Scientist, Spectroscopist / PAT Support
job description:
The Senior Associate Scientist will join the SPECTech Group whose mission is to elevate the understanding of process operations through the appropriate use of integrated PAT technology, multivariate data analytics and advanced process control in support of drug substance and drug product development and manufacturing. The candidate with help with the development of FAST platform technologies by utilizing appropriate sensors and online analytics. The candidate will work with vibrational spectroscopy instruments, perform multivariate data analytics and draw appropriate conclusions from various experiments.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Collaborate with project team to monitor reactions to enhance process understanding.
  • Assist with instrument support, calibration and installation across the Pfizer suite of activities in support of drug substance synthesis.
  • Support the development of FAST platform technologies by utilizing PAT approaches for process monitoring.
  • Contribute to the data analyses of reactions, drawing appropriate conclusions and summarizing in oral and written communications as needed.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
  • BS/MS Degree and 0-3 years of experience in Analytical Chemistry or Engineering.
  • Knowledgeable in vibrational spectroscopy (NIR, IR, Raman, UV-Vis) as well as understanding of other analytical techniques such as MS, NMR, HPLC and GC.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Microsoft Office, Matlab, or other chemometrics software is desirable.
  • Engineering experience: unit operations, process engineering, and continuous manufacturing is a plus.
  • Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills.
  • Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude.
  • Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies.
NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS

Role may require some off-hour availability to provide remote support for design, implementation, and/or system troubleshooting for operations in other time zones.
